g.text: Andrade, Faustino, Garcia, Ladeiras, Reis & Rijo
Regarding the lack of regulation, PBMs can be adulteratedandcontaminatedin countries where purity andquality
. In many cases, these adulterated products can cause signiﬁcant health problems
Ayurvedic products are often prepared with inorganic active compounds, which when combined with environmental
pollution (such as pesticides), can increase the content of heavy metals above the permissible limits
Standardization deﬁned as the normalization of a sample that can have a minimal amount of one or more
. Unfortunately, phytotherapy rarely satisﬁes the standardization norms
This is mainly due to the lack of information about pharmacologically active compounds, and to the plants not
being grown in a controlled environment
. The variability of the content and concentration of constituents
in a plant, together with the various extraction and processing techniques used by different manufacturers, lead to
variability in the content and quality of marketed PBM
. The consistency in composition and biological
activity are prerequisites for the safe and effective use of therapeutic products
family, which is one of the largest and most distinguished families of ﬂowering
plants, including about 236 genera and 6900–7200 species worldwide
because the ﬂowers typically have petals fused into top and bottom lips, although currently most botanists use the
is well known for its biologically active essential oils, common to many family members, its
ornamental and culinary herbs such as basil, lavender, mint, rosemary, sage and thyme
Several studies report the presence of a wide variety of compounds such as terpenes, iridoids, ﬂavonoids and
phenolic compounds in plants of the family. The
family includes species of plants containing large
amounts of phenolic acids, such as rosmarinic acid, which have antibacterial, antiviral, antioxidant and anti-
Many species of this family have been the subject of experimental studies conﬁrming the effectiveness of some
spp. (thyme) has antibacterial activity due to the presence of thymol and can
be used as a disinfectant; lavender oil, containing terpenic compounds, is used in the treatment of dandruff and
hair growth, and also has antimicrobial, antiviral and antifungal properties; the aerial parts of
Vahl. are effective in the improvement of anxiety disorders due to the presence of apigenin and luteolin in
Mill is used for inﬂammation, cough, as a sedative and in digestive problems;
and compounds such as 1,8-cineole are very common in the genus
The following sections will further address an important species of the
is very common in Portugal, mainly focusing on its biological compounds and activities.

), and original fromthe temperate countries of the Mediterranean region, such as
